alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 13 at 1:59PM MST until February 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected with blowing snow and near blizzard conditions. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Wind gusts up to 60 to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Gila Region and Sacramento mountains. * WHEN...11 PM MST Tuesday to 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Falling snow and strong winds will combine to produce low visibilities and very difficult travel, especially along US-82, US-70, NM-152, and NM-15. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will begin during the hours in the Gila on Tuesday, lasting through the morning hours Wednesday. Snow will start in the Sacramento mountains early morning on Wednesday before tapering Wednesday afternoon. DeL
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is a potential for significant snow, sleet, or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range
